definitions.text: (used of vowels or syllables) pronounced with little or no stress
examples: a syllable that ends in a short vowel is a light syllable
a weak stress on the second syllable

definitions.text: wanting in moral strength, courage, or will; having the attributes of man as opposed to e.g. divine beings

examples: a weak market for oil stocks

definitions.text: deficient or lacking in some skill
lacking bodily or muscular strength or vitality
(used of verbs) having standard (or regular) inflection
not having authority, political strength, or governing power
deficient in magnitude; barely perceptible; lacking clarity or brightness or loudness etc
examples: the wan sun cast faint shadows
the faint light of a distant candle

definitions.text: likely to fail under stress or pressure
examples: the weak link in the chain

definitions.text: deficient in intelligence or mental power
